thread.title: Canton Woman Charged With Drunk Driving Had BAC Of .441
thread.title_full: Canton Woman Charged With Drunk Driving Had BAC Of .441

author: CBS Boston
title: Canton Woman Charged With Drunk Driving Had BAC Of .441
text:
Canton Woman Charged With Drunk Driving Had BAC Of .441 March 23, 2017 12:26 PM Filed Under: Canton , Drunk Driving , Rhode Island 
JOHNSTON, R.I. (CBS) – A Massachusetts woman was charged with drunk driving after she recorded a blood alcohol content of .411. 
Rhode Island State Police received multiple 911 calls Wednesday just before 5 p.m. for an erratic operator on Route 295 south in Johnston. 
Troopers found the driver near Exit 6 and identified her as Elizabeth Salah, 23, of Canton. 
Police said she showed “obvious signs of intoxication” and failed all field sobriety tests. 
Salah’s initial blood alcohol test yielded a result of .411 while a second result displayed .391. 
She was arraigned on a drunk driving charge following her arrest. 
She was issued a re-arraignment date of April 6 and released into the custody of her parents.
